intro: Tingulonga tenuifolia, commonly known as the slender leaf tingulonga, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, elongated leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and traditional herbal practices.
